annotations.description: The players of both teams deserve praise from their managers and supporters for their performance on the pitch. If they carry on playing this exciting brand of football in future games, then the fans will surely be right behind them. The away side dominated this game. The home side were defending patiently to win the ball off the opponent and launch the counter. However, the away side moved the ball around and were waiting for a gap to appear in the home side's defence.

annotations.description: Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Mario Gotze, then sends the ball low into the middle of the net. 1:2.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Tobias Stieler shows the yellow card to Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) for a heavy challenge.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) leaps high to meet a lofted pass inside the six yard box, but his header only flies onto the right post and away off it!
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) escapes his marker to meet a cross and heads to the middle of the goal, but the keeper pulls off an excellent reflex save to deny him.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) goes over to take the corner kick and it looks like he will swing the ball into the penalty box. Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) takes the corner with a short pass.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) decided to shoot after receiving a sweet pass. If it wasn't for Oliver Baumann's superb save the ball would have probably ended up in the bottom right corner. Bayern Munich earn a corner.
Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) is able to continue to play.
Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) fouls an opponent. At least that's what referee Tobias Stieler signals.
Some great controlled play and passing in the middle of the pitch from Hoffenheim.

annotations.label: injury

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Rafinha (Bayern Munich) was quite harsh and Tobias Stieler didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

CLOSE! Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the right post! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayern Munich.

annotations.label: y-card

annotations.label: corner

annotations.label: penalty-missed

annotations.label: yr-card
annotations.description: It's too late to protest, Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) has to leave the pitch after receiving a second yellow card.

annotations.label: penalty

Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) attempts to curl the ball over the wall from the free kick, but one of the defenders deflects it away from danger.
Hoffenheim are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Tobias Stieler didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Douglas Costa plays a lovely pass into Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Hoffenheim will have a goal kick.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.

annotations.label: substitution

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) picks up a pass and unleashes a low shot towards goal, but he can't generate enough power to trouble Oliver Baumann.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch so that Philipp Lahm can be given a rest.

OFF THE CROSSBAR! Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hoffenheim.
Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) sends a teasing cross into the area, but Oliver Baumann intercepts the ball.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: Everything is set for the start of the second half.

It was a good decision to watch today's encounter. There has already been more to see prior to the half time break than there is in most games during the full 90 minutes. The visitors are mostly controlling the match and making it tough for the home side to keep up. The home side is creating their opportunities using lightning fast counter attacks. The tactic of the away side is slow build up play.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) is adjudged to have been offside when making his run.

annotations.label: time
annotations.description: 1 additional min. will be played.

Ambitious effort from Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hoffenheim.
The Hoffenheim players are exchanging fine passes and are waiting for an opportunity to start an attack, but here's a mistake and a loss of possession.

Good afternoon, ladies and gentleman! Welcome to our live text commentary, where we will provide you with instant updates of everything that happens in the match.

The players of both teams deserve praise from their managers and supporters for their performance on the pitch. If they carry on playing this exciting brand of football in future games, then the fans will surely be right behind them. The away side dominated this game. The home side were defending patiently to win the ball off the opponent and launch the counter. However, the away side moved the ball around and were waiting for a gap to appear in the home side's defence.
